title: Justice Department Significantly Downsizes Public Corruption Investigation Unit
summary: The Justice Department dramatically reduced the Public Integrity Section, cutting its staff from dozens to approximately 6 prosecutors, effectively dismantling its capacity to independently investigate government corruption. The unit, created in 1976 following the Watergate scandal, will no longer directly handle corruption investigations, with cases to be reassigned to U.S. attorneys' offices.
